main event: A sighting of an orange object reported as bright as sunset over Three Oaks, Michigan on June 5, 1954.
interesting points: The object was observed for 15 minutes and estimated to move at the speed of sound,There were three objects that may have been a meteor or stars,The brightness of the object was compared to that of Saturn,No distinctive lights were noted during the observation,The report concludes it could be a balloon or aircraft but mentions insufficient data for firm analysis.
sighted object: one orange object moving at high speed
